snippet: Thomas Lubanga, a rebel leader from the Congo, was found guilty on Tuesday of recruiting and enlisting boys and girls under the age of 15 and using them to make war.
abstract: Thomas Lubanga, a rebel leader from the Congo, is found guilty of recruiting and enlisting boys and girls under the age of 15 and using them to fight, in the first ruling by the International Criminal Court since it began its work 10 years ago.

byline.contributor: Josh Kron contributed reporting from Kampala, Uganda.

lead_paragraph: Thomas Lubanga, a rebel leader from the Congo, was found guilty on Tuesday of recruiting and enlisting boys and girls under the age of 15 and using them to make war.

headline.seo: Congolese Warlord Convicted of Using Child Soldiers
headline.main: Congolese Warlord Convicted, in First for International Court
headline.print_headline: Congolese Rebel Convicted of Using Child Soldiers

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
